content.question: Using the three methods shown above, a small block is raised from rest on the ground until it is again at rest a distance <math alttext="d" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> above the ground. In method <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> a rope pulls the block straight up, and in methods <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> the block is pushed up frictionless ramps of different lengths. Which of the following ranks the total work <math alttext="W" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> done on the block by external forces as the block is raised using each method?

choices.label: <math alttext="W sub 1 equals W sub 2, which equals W sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="W sub 1 is greater than W sub 2, which is greater than W sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="W sub 1 is greater than, open parenthesis, W sub 2 equals W sub 3, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="W sub 3 is greater than W sub 2, which is greater than W sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="W sub 1 equals W sub 2, which equals W sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
